This is a list of flags used in the '''[[Republic of Korea]]'''. ==National== {{main|Flag of South Korea}} {| border="2" cellpadding="4" cellspacing="0" width="820px" style="margin: 1em 1em 1em 0; background: #f9f9f9; border: 1px #aaa solid; border-collapse:collapse;width:820px;" |- bgcolor="#efefef" !Flag!!width="110px"|Date!!width="220px"|Use!!Description |- bgcolor="#efefef" !colspan="4"|Present National Flag |- | [[File:Flag of South Korea.svg|border|150px]] || 1948âpresent || [[Flag of South Korea|Flag of the Republic of Korea]]
''(Taegeukgi)'' || White field with a red and blue ''[[taegeuk]]'' in the center and four black [[ba gua|trigrams]], one in each corner of the flag |- bgcolor="#efefef" !colspan="4"|Historical version |- | [[File:Flag of Korea 1882.svg|border|150px]] |rowspan="3"|1882â1910 |rowspan="3"| Flag of [[Korean Empire]] ([[Joseon Dynasty]])
The middle version is depicted in the 1882 US Navy book, ''Flags of Maritime Nations''. Lower is in the 1944 United States [[Overrun Countries series|postage stamp series]]. {{FIAV|historical}} |rowspan="3"|The old Korean imperial flag had a different ''[[taegeuk]]'' from that in the modern flag. Note that the 1882 U.S. Navy depiction may be left-right reversed. The arrangement of the [[ba gua|trigrams]] was not officially fixed until an ordinance of 1948, when the South Korean government was established. |- | [[File:Taegukgi.jpg|border|150px]] |- | [[File:Korean flag 1944 United States stamp detail.jpg|border|150px]] |} ==National Government== {| border="2" cellpadding="4" cellspacing="0" width="820px" style="margin: 1em 1em 1em 0; background: #f9f9f9; border: 1px #aaa solid; border-collapse: collapse;width:820px;" |- bgcolor="#efefef" !Flag!!width="110px"|Date!!width="220px"|Use!!Description |- | [[File:Presidential Standard of the Republic of Korea.svg|150px|border]] || 1967 â present || [[President of South Korea|Presidential]] Standard || Two [[Fenghuang|Phoenix]] taking golden ''[[Hibiscus syriacus]]'' under their wings. |- | [[File:Standard of the Prime Minister of the Republic of Korea.svg|150px|border]] || 1988 â present || Standard of the [[Prime Minister of South Korea|Prime Minister]] || Golden ''[[Hibiscus syriacus]]'' inlaid in symbolic ''Hibiscus syriacus'' insignia |- | [[File:Flag of the Government of the Republic of Korea.svg|150px|border]] || 1988 â present || Flag of the [[Government of South Korea|National Government]] || Symbolic ''[[Hibiscus syriacus]]'' insignia, inlaid with the word {{lang|ko|ì ë¶}}(RR:''jeongbu'',MR:''chÅngbu''), or ''the National Government''. |} ==Military== {| border="2" cellpadding="4" cellspacing="0" width="820px" style="margin: 1em 1em 1em 0; background: #f9f9f9; border: 1px #aaa solid; border-collapse: collapse;width:820px;" |- bgcolor="#efefef" !Flag!!width="110px"|Date!!width="220px"|Use!!Description |- | [[File:Mnd mark.gif|border|150px]] || ? - present || Flag of the [[Ministry of National Defense (South Korea)|Ministry of National Defense]] || Insignia of the Ministry on red field. |- | [[File:Flag of the Army of of the Republic of Korea.svg|border|150px]] || ? - present || Flag of the [[Republic of Korea Army|Army]] || Insignia of the Army on a field parted ''per fess'', above is white, below is blue. |- | [[File:Naval Jack of South Korea.svg|border|150px]] || 1955 â present || [[Republic of Korea Navy|Naval]] [[Maritime flag|Jack]]|| ''[[Taegeuk]]'' on crossed anchors, in a white canton on a blue field. |- | [[File:Flag of Republic of Korea Marine Corps.svg|border|150px]] || 1951 â present || Flag of the [[Republic of Korea Marine Corps|Marine Corps]] || The similarity with the [[Flag of the United States Marine Corps|flag of the USMC]] shows the strong influence of the US since the creation of South Korean armed forces. |- | [[File:Roundel of the Republic of Korea Air Force.svg|120px]] || 2005 â present || Roundel of the [[Republic of Korea Air Force|Air Force]] || |- | [[File:ROKAF Roundel 1950s-2000s.svg|120px]] || 1951â2005 || Old roundel || |} {{Lists of flags}} {{DEFAULTSORT:South Korean Flags}} [[Category:Lists of flags|Korea, South]] [[Category:South Korea-related lists|Flags]] [[Category:National symbols of South Korea|List of South Korean Flags]] {{SouthKorea-stub}} {{asia-flag-stub}} [[ko:íêµ­ì ê¸° ëª©ë¡]] [[th:à¸à¸à¹à¸à¸à¸£à¸°à¹à¸à¸¨à¹à¸à¸²à¸«à¸¥à¸µà¹à¸à¹]]
